t3KTVcpB0E00Picr6Fu10w.text: The food here is really good. The food available in the bar is excellent value and really tasty. Great for sharing -meze plates of houmous etc and very good Koftas, calamari with rose syrup dip, good falafel. There is a great outside area and a plethora of foliage to hide from the boss on a sunny weekday lunchtime. The grilled chicken salad is excellent and comes in at about £6.Only minus side is that they keep changing the seating, so fingers crossed you'll get a comfy place to park!

dfoQ_OQXyXw-bp9vQOnlAg.text: The food is really amazing in both the restaurant and the cafe, but cheaper at the salad bar in the cafe. Lovely atmosphere for catching up with friends. Cheap and cheerful and quiet (great for book club meetings!). Also lovely in the summer as it is a pedestrian street only so no cars or traffic! I would love to keep this to myself, but it's such a gem!

PcuJz15VDWCxmFPSGwD6dQ.text: This place is just amazing, there's a cafe, restaurant and bar under the same roof but in different sections, creating perfect ambiances and the food is just delicious. I had a lamb dish and someone on the table next to me leaned over and asked what it was as it looked so amazing. The atmosphere was perfect and the food too. I would strongly recommend a visit.

Cp-eRlZP6peAhB0hH-_xKg.text: I came here on a date. Lets just say my date seemed more interested in me than the staff. We were served by several manic depressive waiters. All apart from one lady seemed that had a pretentious smile but made an effort anyways as all the other waiters relied on her. They all seemed to hate their jobs! Not showing a smile, and not even asking which meal was for whom or naming the dishes. My dish seemed to be plonked on the table which startled the conversation flow on the date! Regarding the food:I had a starter of Dolma which had tender wine leaves but still crisp to the bite. With a comforting filling of rice, sultanas, and spices. It came served with a dainty chopped salad. My date had sucuk (sujuk) which had a little kick of spice. I then had the Iskendar, a dish consisting of chopped lamb, chopped bread, and submerged in a spicey red sauce with yogurt. To be honest I was a little disappointed as for some reason they decided to FRY the bread! Only adding to the calories.and not making the bread distinguishable. The presentation was nice however I had to find the bread buried underneath it all and even had to ask the water to aid me in this search. Deep fried it appeared almost as if it was a soggy over cooked potato. My date however chose a wonderful broadbean dish which had a very thin almost consume tomato dressing the beans with decorative thinly sliced beetroot and small potatoes. Very simplistic but sophisticated none the less. Regarding the drink:I opted for Ayran which is a yogurt based drink. It did need some salt or mint or even fizzy water to give it a kick. Otherwise it was basically watered down yogurt.Regarding the bread, yogurt, and olives:When sat down you are presented with bread, yogurt (which my date who is lactose intolerant thought was hummus..as it was covered in spices) and olives. They were fine and good to ease the stomach before a meal.TO CONCLUDE:Come here if you don't care for service.if you love vegetarian dishes as there are plenty to choose from. Also if you are not on a date!

GIJnzheLV8SwRX_v0LZtiA.text: Geez, I'm head over heel for this place. I work close so I go there for lunch nearly every day, like most employees, Ev is our unofficial canteen. The food is top notch, for £5 you have a fairly big meal, it's clean, it's bright, it's cheerful, the staff is kind - it really ticks all the boxes for me. Only one note: if you're vegetarian, pay some attention to the salads you choose - of the twenty-so varieties on sale, at least one has meat into it. In doubt, just ask, the staff will tell you.

jM_24jwSbHUMwLeeKvZX5Q.text: I love this combination of restaurant and bar. The surroundings are very stylish, and there's a great atmosphere inside, with everyone having a good time. Last time we came here, we had a large order just before the kitchen closed, but the staff were still so helpful and brought extras, even though I'm sure they just wanted to get home! I'll definately be returning here for the wonderful food and a good night out.

AdZY7oRD6PKdCCaGuKSv1w.text: This place is like a little oasis in the desert of Waterloo. Hidden in the railway arches behind a wall of greenery, it was hard to choose between the deli, the bar and the restaurant arch. In the end we went for the restaurant, and had a lovely vegetarian mezze spread, with the house red, which was very drinkable. The desserts were good, and the choice was wider than in most Turkish restaurants. The service was impeccable. The waiters were friendly and attentive. I took one star away because the waiters have to scrape up the crumbs from the table with a little silver scraper thing between courses which was unnecessarily formal and made me feel uncomfortable.

aR0HzxiEMu7PvaoYg37hbw.text: This was such a surprising find. Searched the area for a lovely spot that I havent tried yet for something to eat with my parents and thanks to YELP found this little beauty down isabella street. Its like stepping into a little secret garden, with the greenery on the alleyway. The arches is gorgeous and the restaurant is decorated to compliment it.But onto the food. The menu was extensive including a delicious smattering of fish. We couldn't decide so we ordered quite a few starters and two main courses to share.We're a big fan of squid and there were many options including a delicious calarmari style dish with a sour rose sauce that was simply divine.I can't speak to having eaten a lot of Turkish food, but this place certainly seems to have an authenticity to it and a friendly set of staff that would certainly place this restaurant on the map for me to return to. Well worth a look if you're looking for something a little different.

KR97NLI0iSWzlE6q-DwuEg.text: Great location, great food.  I was with a Greek friend, which makes him much more qualified to order food from a neighboring land than this guy.  So he ordered a bunch of food and we ate family style...I tried everything and loved it all.  Lamb, squid, veggies, you name it.  I had a few beers at the Purple cow before hand so I won't give it 5-stars as it may just have tasted good because of the buzz I had.

vohut5Orggb0-8hnh4BPbg.text: I love this place, and it's a great place to know if you're looking to get a pre-theatre dinner when going to the National or the Young/Old Vic.I usually eat in the cafe/bar area on the left as you look in.  The counter service food is great value for money - you get four salads for around £5, and it comes with a little basket of bread as well.  There are various hot options as well, but I usually don't look much further than the salads: dolmades, tabouleh, dishes that do amazing things with chick peas and aubergenes.If you're there with friends (and it's a good place for that) I recommend that you divide up the sauces/dips between you - the tzatziki and hummus are both great, but count as one of your salad portions and the servings are huge.The baclava is tasty if that's your thing.  They have some great regional beers, and their wine is cheap and drinkable.Ev has so much more character and is much better value than the chains swamping the South Bank.  Plus it's independent, which is surely enough of a attraction in itself.I've eaten in the more formal restuarant too, and it was tasty and pretty good value.  But it's the salad bar to which I find myself returning time and time again.  Give it a try.

W5dghdKxB7WrvzziTGtYXg.text: Nice folk, good coffee, good pastry, food salat. Turkish-ish. Loads of stuff lke feta and kefir on the side...and, of course, Nairn's.Really just lovely and nice-- get a variety of salads meze style and eat on these tail end of summer sunny days.

p2qC-sfd1DGS9piWgHLpxA.text: Outstanding menu with many choices and very reasonably priced.  Everything on the meze plate was delicious.

3SyT3l_A5Hck-DBWRHvJCA.text: EV is a great little place - a nice tucked away location with great food.  My partner and I tend to go for the vegetarian meze which has a really nice mix of foods.  My only complaint is that it's a little on the pricey side for what it is but since this is London that's (unfortunately) to be expected.

A1TVmkKO6s9YtEq5vS4Vcg.text: There are very few good things I can say about this place which makes me sad. My boyfriend has talked about going here many times - the location is excellent, especially for outdoor dining in London. It's set back from the main road in this weird little garden like street which is adorable. We actually went there looking for a Thai place and ended up at this place when the Thai restaurant was closed. Since I had been told it was good, I was expecting a lot, and it was a complete disappointment.We had the set menu - for £17.95 you get a bunch of starters and a main. Some of the starters were OK, but pretty standard. The wine we ordered was good, but not great - Rare Vinyards Pinot Noir. And then the mains came. Out of 4 of us we had: king prawns (read tiny shrimp in a sauce that was far too sweet and oily), lamb (read skinny little slices of lamb over mashed potatoes), chicken kebab (looked ok - didn't ask my brother how it was but very standard) and calamari which actually looked quite good.In the end, it just did not impress other than the location. I would not go back - you can get way better Turkish/Greek food in London, which does make me kind of sad as the location is great and so out of the way feeling. Oh well.

4JnTEx313Xj2y-3kIqT66Q.text: EV is Anatolian for home and that's a perfect description of this Turkish restaurant that serves up "tastes of home" each and every day. Located underneath the railroad tracks, the sweeping coved ceiling , the modern chairs, and the beautiful outside garden seating lets you know that whatever meal you are having here is going to be special. We were seated at the edge of the patio (more in than out) which was fine on the day we were there as the sun was having the same kind of day (more in than out!) We were presented with 3 menu options- the a la carte menu, the prix fixe menu or the specials of the day menu. Since our group was large and we wanted to taste a wide range of the menu- we went with the prix fixe menu where we all got to share a wide range of appetizers but could pick our own entrees. Dipping yogurt and bread were placed on the tables (watch that bread- it is addictive!) and then our first cold appetizers arrived. Too many to mention here by name but aubergine (eggplant), hummus, couscous and some white bean dish were my favorites. The hot appetizers were falafel and a warm spinach turnover. By this point- I really didn't need my entree but it was quite good. I had the lamb steak that was served with mashed potatoes and most of my colleagues had the chicken shish kabobs. All of the food was well seasoned and gave a nod to why this would be "comfort food". Too full for dessert- but the owner/manager came over with Turkish delight candies. Now I had had these before- but never so fresh and sweet (and I thought I didn't like Turkish delight!) Close to the Southwerk tube station, EV is a great choice for lunch or dinner alone- or with a group. After all- who doesn't need a little more "home" in their life?

MP3zDE7YULz3ennFJyqe8w.text: Used to work in the Southwark area and made sure that I paid Ev a visit every couple of weeks for lunch. The service is quick and the food just beautiful.You can choose from their deli bar that's filled fresh salads (please try the aubergine and chicken salami salad!), cakes and boreks. There's also an open plan kitchen so you can see how they make the bread in house.Great alternative to your bog standard sandwich places in the area.

pFmy2oa_XtnF7q1KNVkbtA.text: I like a dry white wine. And I like a restaurant that can make this recommendation. Yes a bit wine snobby but if I'm going to spend money out then I at least want to spend it on something I will enjoy. A typical transaction should be I ask what is dry and crisp, you point me in the right direction. Not try to assert all the wines are dry and crisp. Cause I'm not a wine expert but dessert wine doesn't typically fall under the dry category. Next time I'll stick to ordering the lovely food at the cafe.

VwgV3tdJkjJs4qYqR5Fuqw.text: I have never had Turkish food, but this definitely was a treat for me. Considering my study abroad program paid for this delicious excursion as our first official dinner, I definitely feel that this place will always have a special place in my heart. We had some hummus, eggplant, delicious calamari (with a hint of honey), some yogurt sort of dip with eggplant, lamb meat balls, and 2 other dishes i don't recall. I also ordered the black mulberry juice. It tasted like any ordinary juice to me. Overall, this was a wonderful experience.

OX3dyilKlb0QXF-9EkMATA.text: Stunning food in an awesome environment.  I've eaten here three times, and each time I have made plans to bring a large party of friends here as well for a party.  The restaurant looks wonderful, the staff are helpful, and the food is amazing.  The bar area also is very impressive, just like a nightclub.  I've eaten kebabs, vine leaves, and the lamb which was incredible.  The olives and bread are great as well.  The Baklava are truly scrumptious, rich and satisfying.   (epsecially with a little pouring cream)I wouldn't hesitate to go back again.  I also really liked the way that even in a large venue, that the waiters and waiteresses give you room to breathe, and the tables are nicely laid out so as to be still quite intimate.

lD9WIhYJKREZHgOXP_yVbA.text: I need to remember this place exists more often! Like many people, I originally discovered it when Taz was packed to the rafters and I was hankering after Turkish mezze. I wasn't disappointed, as the food is every bit as tasty as what you'll find in its sister restaurant, but there's slightly more of a party atmosphere in the lofty dining room. The palms and foliage are slightly tacky in the best possible way, and the wine list is surprisingly extensive. Great for groups, it does what it does very well.

fNipWWyRuVQCP1Ei7QL3Og.text: I see I'm bucking the trend by only awarding 3 stars, but no matter how long I analyse it - this was not a 4 or 5 star experience for me. We went for lunch on a Sunday - in the restaurant (as opposed to the more casual deli/restaurant). For quite a while we were the only table and this may have been the problem. Food was great quality, the Chilean wine we chose was lovely too, but the service was simply not exciting. Bland, no personality, ok efficiency. I'll definitely be trying the deli/restaurant as well as the bar area. The deli section was absolutely buzzing and the bar area looked ever so interesting. I can imaging the restaurant could be fab with more customers in it.

WETtGCDKdN5FRKgFsGXfjQ.text: I've been here for drinkeies but having peered through the archway would definitely head there for eaties as well! Really great decoration full with foliage hanging from the ceiling and a waterfall in the corner! Also a great cocktail list! Definitely somewhere to go again!

Odv-Q3uyIS8QhSXKa5_hmw.text: Looking for a pre-theatre meal we managed to get a table even though it was very busy. Great venue in a group of restaurants under the railway arches. Outside area and bar next door through arch. Nice to have yoghurt and bread to nibble while browsing the menu as I don't like olives! Excellent selection of Turkish food including plenty of vegetarian options. Good atmosphere and nice place for parties.

ZeQnVqjX2NPyIMADEM-EqQ.text: I went here for dinner last night, and, boy, did this seal the deal!  It was delicious  I got the 11 pound menu and it was delicious, copious, zesty, flavorful, and nothing short of mmhmmm amazing!   Great bang for your buck

X4y00B46r8MtbmDlkXZnMA.text: Went for lunch in the bar with my girlfriend on a Sunday, I think there were only about 5 other people in the bar. We had two meals with drinks for £25 which we paid for. When I went to get coffees after the meal I was told that they wouldnt take my card as the coffees were £4 and the minimum spend on a card was £5. The location is great and the food is ok but the staff are uninterested. The barman in particular didnt seem to care at all

jyvFM0-uDIApmY5IRHdRcQ.text: Went to Ev within the first weeks of it originally opening, and still find myself going there again and again. Food is consistently good, and love the hide away location. Remains of my of favourite spots in Town.

UpMDnhKyL80iHQAbq2XMWw.text: I love this place! It's so affordable and almost everything in the deli is vegetarian so it's a delight as I'm always spoilt for choice. I've been to the restaurant and bar too which has more choice for those who like meat and they have more hot dishes to choose from than the deli.The deli is great for lunch and a choice of three is usually enough for me. The wine is quite good at the restaurant which surprised me the first time I tried it as I hadn't associated wine production with Turkey.

8ZvfIf3YyildLh3KWp4_Yw.text: In comparison to its other branch TAS on the cut, ev is a much more relaxed place, good for big groups. The place is big so there is almost never a wait. Servers are nice and service is fast. Howevevr if you are seated in the corner you might have to make extra effort to get their attention sometimes but thats just because of the size of restaurant, lol. For food I can only vouch for lamb insik (lamb shank) and hummus since i always end up ordering the lamb shank, its really good. The restaurant is located on a small road off from the cut and  might take time to find.

photos.caption: Photo of Ev Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Ev
Photo of Ev Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Lamb shank with potato

bKBO-0T8n7BVQVv5ujSMnw.text: Very good. Stumbled upon here when we were in London. Purely based off of really neat greenery outside. We had no idea this was Turkish, we actually never tried Turkish before. That being said, we went on a limb and ordered what sounded good. It was amazing. What a great experience. The meat was perfect and the calamari was cooked right. Would go again when visiting. Beautiful atmosphere

photos.caption: Photo of Ev Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Grilled and stuffed calamari
Photo of Ev Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Neat entree (lamb, chicken and beef)

Zf0JmGMwtYW6yALgYuUrQA.text: It is nice to see more and more places popping up in this previously quite deserted area.  EV is perfect for a quick fix before or after a visit to the theatre or Tate Modern.  It's self-service with all mezze dishes on display behind a massive glass counter.I can't remember exactly how much they charged for a selection of four salad items, but the portions were very generous and good value.  Mind you I wasn't as impressed as I have been at TAS proper (they belong to the same group).  The tzatziki and grilled aubergines were rather bland.  I was impressed by the freshness of the parsley salad though and felt I was eating healthy food.EV is located under some railway arches and has the ambience of a generic self-service buffet restaurant - the type you get at National Trust properties.  It somewhat lacks in atmosphere, even though the turquoise chandeliers add a touch of class.  In summary: more of a quick lunch fix than a destination for a good night out.

photos.caption: Photo of Ev Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

5h8dbQDY3PBHhLoeqzE4gw.text: This was a great experience for us. The food was very good. Really enjoyed the dolmas-grape leaf rolls and domates-meat balls along with the family tapas type assortment.

XvWbym_YUdnwsiV0JP-D4Q.text: I'm just obsessed with this place. Quiet. Relaxed. Yummy healthy FRESH food and very reasonably priced. I don't want this to be the type of place people go to work as it's the nice type of place you can meet for a coffee and catch up and that's what it's perfect for. I also love how it's never disgustingly busy but always accessible as its hidden off the main road under some beautifully placed foliage.

1blyV9UCmo9TqMr6dllUVg.text: Always lovely, food trays great and you get your money's worth. The ambience is always just right, not to noisey or quiet still had that Mediterranean feel about it. You forget that you're in Southwark,best of all next to the Jubilee line, and lots of buses.

photos.caption: Photo of Ev Restaurant - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Ev Restaurant - London, United Kingdom

PSDZoDpGfjPWR4_bAMPmUA.text: Spacious and well decorated. Suitable for a couples as well as groups. Service was good if a bit slow. Food was excellent and well presented. It has tables outside surrounded with tall potted plants. The arched ceiling with wood decorations makes the inside look curated and warm.It's more expensive compared to Turkish restaurants in, say, Dalston. But it's also a step up.

Ldf4FyIVktk0aH1t3ITWww.text: If I could give 3.5 stars, that's exactly what I would give.  Overall, a solid place with particular strengths in a couple areas: First, the venue is quite well-done with a cute edifice and spacious interior.  The ambience is suitable for any occasion as well; when we went, they had a live guitar solo playing which added to the experience. Last but not least, the food was solid.  We ordered two starters (prawns, squid) and two mains (I ordered steak with chips), all of which were tasty and fulfilling.  I particularly liked the seasonings on the steak; it was just the adequate Turkish twist to a classic steak dish.It's a good place to go after a hangout in the South Bank area.

cP6QgDCr7TYizr1jECdX3w.text: Such a pleasant place for lunch. The outdoor patio opens up in the spring and summer months.The menu, as I interpret is, is an amalgam of all cuisines near east with an overarching Lebanese theme. There's something for everyone but more so for the carnivores amongst us.

photos.caption: Photo of Ev Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Lamb shish lunch

x3bsneZPcuUTVSJpzSQynw.text: I do like this bar! I haven't eaten in the restaurant so I won't comment on it, but I do like this bar! Isabella Street is such a cool place to come after work - loads of bars under the railway arches, all linked by some pretty outdoor trellis. A great atmosphere to have a nice cool glass of wine or cider on a summer evening after work.EV bar itself is a bit overpriced and a bit dark, but it's always quick to get to the bar since there are so many you can go to down this street. All in all, a great way to spend an evening :)Note to self, must try the food...

4t_wET_A0ku87wDZyFpPOg.text: Ev Restaurant, The Archers - a quiet neighbourhood but as you take the turn and see the crowd, the place is alive. The Ev Restaurant is under the arches. The dining space at Ev is large with beautiful bricked walls. There were the few iconic Middle Eastern style hanging lamps - colourful. No other decoration was needed to give the place a personality.Throughout the festive season, ie. Christmas and New Year, corporate parties and friends getting together mean it is better to book and secure yourself a table. We turned up, without a reservation, but they very kindly gave us a table. Partly luck, partly I think it means more business for them. We were seated near to the entrance door which in a windy wintery night was not a good idea. It was either that or the opposite restaurant, which is also owned by Ev, but I heard the menu was slightly pricier.The place is very noisy. You have to shout to converse. Occasionally when the train passes above the place is drowned by the sound of the tracks. No one takes any notice and the chatter just continues, on a louder decibel range. Sadly for the musician, no one paid any attention to him and his music.The open kitchen captured my attention. It was only partially opened. There is a larger space at the back but from the customer front, one can see the bread making and the grills and the salad section. It is a relatively small space in proportion to the number of chefs working. The madness of cooking and serving performed like an organised chaos. It was very theatrical. Ev's menu was quite lengthy and I left it to the friend who is a regular and knows the cuisine well. I realised that a separate vegetarian option was available. We went for the set meze menu. The food was served the minute they took the menus away. Cold dishes were treated as starters. Bread was delicious. I somehow expected it when seeing the huge bread maker clay oven. The smell of freshly made bread is comforting. The hot food consisted mainly of deep-fried dishes. It was difficult to judge on one dish but overall, they all complimented each other very well; herby salad, tomato stew, garlicky houmous and crispy fried batter. It was all flavoursome and different textures making it more interesting to the palate.GBP 11.95 per personbaklava GBP 4.95 - was delicious. Imagine all those honey and sugar drizzles. This is surprisingly not too sweet. Delicious!Service was polite. With the restaurant running at full capacity, the waiters and waitresses still kept up with their charming attitude. I prefer not to have them hovering over us, filling our wine glasses and checking our food intake every five minutes. At Ev, we were left to our own time, talking and eating. Place was noisy with chatteres. Outside, people were still drinking. And this will probably continue towards early hours of the morning.

f37PDHZ1eaQjS99T07JsNA.text: This fantastic turkish restaurant is hidden just behind Southwark station, and covered by plant growth. The restaurant is basically located in a converted railway tunnel which adds to the charm.I selected the lunch menu. Despite the items being extrmely hard to pronounce I managed to order a starter and a main. The starter was a calamari rings in batter with a sweet chilli dressing followed by an adequate main of 4 chicken patties with bulgerwheat and salad. Very tasty, good portion and quality.This is definitely one to try again. The lamb shank looked good from what others ordered and I'll be trying that.

photos.caption: Photo of Ev Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Calamari Starter
Photo of Ev Restaurant - London, United Kingdom. Chicken Patties

Zdrs_71quSlsWEWT48Ja6g.text: I've eaten here twice now and it does everything right.It's a railway arch location and I always think those arches really make for a great space for a restaurant or bar and Ev is no exception.The service is spot on. Greeted quickly on arrival and efficient delivery to a table even when the place is buzzing and full, have had seats straight away.Proceedings start with fresh Turkish bread and garlic yoghurt dip brought to the table (straight away).Hummus is of the super smooth variety and very good too.I can recommend the chicken meatballs with aubergines and have also sampled the moussaka. Both were excellent and served as a complete meal. Portions are generous.The kitchen is open, the waiters are super efficient and attentive and it's a well run operation.Finally, the prices are good so the combination of quality food, service and pricing all makes for a great value proposition. A favourite.

_cauou5idP8RpOPftZzm9A.text: Fun atmosphere and absolutely delicious. Not 5 stars because it was a bit strange that we had to pay extra for rice to be included in our meat platter. But that's my only complaint.

bHsIdFUrJUEW9fdZSgppUg.text: This is a hidden gem! Just round the back of southwark staton is I really enjoyed my experience. The decor is lovely. Great to sit out doors on a nice summers day. Out waiter was very helpful and friendly. All the food we had was yummy and I would def recommend this place.

_Z1lwxMvL7eNY1trJVTnNw.text: Nice decor. Decent food (lamb grilled with mash potatoes). Prices seem fair for what I know of London.  Lamb was little fatty but maybe that's normal. Not overwhelmed with flavor but a nice meal. Staff could be a bit more friendly. ..smile more :)

rAWLwwY4HI1LfHukf39IoQ.text: As others have said, this is in a lovely street garden underneath some railway arches which is an extremely nice environment on a warm summer evening, particularly when they roll back the roof as the sun goes down. The food isn't outstanding but the two course £9.95 menu is good value for fairly decent standard dishes like kalamar and chicken or beef patties. Bit overcooked here and there but generally ok. The menu is extensive so you would probably need to try a few things out to figure out what they do really well. The bread and yoghurt/oil dip which they serve as you're seated was great.It's a very big and busy place so service was quite slow - our drink order came after the food which just feels so wrong! Overall I'd recommend this if you're in the area and want something cheap (NB a la carte is more pricey) and reliable in a very pretty location.

a0J8apgSEBqqdFHJGqVo4g.text: One of my fave lunch hang outs!! Very good value for money. Staff are friendly and the restaurant decor is beautiful with chandeliers and all. Perfect for sitting in, chilling alone or dine in with friends. I often have business meetings in there but it's also a great place to bring family with kids. Tucked away just behind Sourthwark tube, it is very accessible. On a sunny day, you can even sit outside in their garden at the front of the restaurant. It's a very popular place so be prepared to see a long queue. Don't worry though, queues move very quickly! They offer a fabulous selection of delicious Turkish meze as well as pastries, quiches and pizza. It's the place I keep coming back to for quality hummus, served with delicious and free bread. They have off the shelf non-high street produce to buy for presents too. Highly recommended!!

pS4zVIaI3xlhuIhuJNCuoA.text: Fantastic food, in a beautiful environment; underneath one of the railway arches. The mezze food is almost all vegetarian, reasonably well priced for the location and comes with salads and breads. There is both fine dining and cafe style food avaliable, we ate at the cafe, for  a more relaxed lunch environment. Whilst it is a little hard to find, well worth finding.
